question: The minimum period required for post-exposure chemoprophylaxis for HIV is:
exp: Post exposure prophylaxis for HIV: Ideally HIV PEP must be initiated as soon as possible HIV PEP must be initiated within: 24 hours HIV PEP unreasonable to initiate beyond: 72 hours Duration of HIV PEP: 4 weeks Follow-up period after HIV PEP: 12 weeks. Only the higher risk injuries are offered HIV post-exposure prophylaxis which consists of2-3 anti-retroviral medications administered for 28 days. A baseline rapid HIV testing of exposed and source person must be done for PEP. However, initiation of PEP should not be delayed while waiting for the results of HIV testing of the source of exposure PROTOCOL: It is necessary to determine the status of the exposure and the HIV status of the exposure source before staing post exposure prophylaxis (PEP).

question: All of the following are true for 95-95-95 Target except
exp: UNAIDS 95-95-95 TARGET Reaching 95-95-95 in 2024 means ending the AIDS epidemic is possible by 2030 95% of people living with HIV know their status 95% of those who test positive have access to treatment 95% of people under treatment have an undetectable viral load.
opa: 95% of all the people living with HIV will know about their HIV status by 2024.
opb: 95% of all the people diagnosed with HIV will receive A by 2024
opc: 95% of all the people receiving A will have a CD4 count in the normal range by 2024.
opd: 95% of all people receiving A will have a viral load suppression by 2024

question: In the management of leprosy, Lepromin test is most useful for:-
exp: In the management of leprosy, Lepromin test is most useful for prognosis. LEPROMIN TEST: - The test is performed by injecting intradermally 0. 1 ml of lepromin at inner aspect of the forearm of the individual. - Two types of positive reaction have been described: Early reaction - also known as FERNANDEZ reaction, read after 3 days Late reaction - also known as MITSUDA reaction, read after 3 weeks - Lepromin test is not a diagnostic test. The test has been generally accepted as a useful tool in evaluating the immune status (CMI) of leprosy patients. - The test is also of great value in estimating the prognosis in case of leprosy of all types.

question: Bird-Ahropod-Man transmission is seen in
exp: Basic cycles of transmission for JE virus: Pig --> Mosquito --> Pig Ardeid Bird --> Mosquito --> Ardeid Bird JAPANESE ENCEPHALITIS: - Caused by Group-B arbovirus - Vector - Culex triteniorhynchus - Amplifier host - pig; Actual host - Ardied birds - Accidental "dead-end" host - Man - Mosquito attractants - cattle/ horses - I. P: 5-15 days - Case fatality rate: 30% - Age group commonly affected: 1-15 yrs - Vaccines: Live strain - SA-14-14-2 at 9 AM - 16-24 months Killed strain - Nakayama, Beijing P3

question: Most efficient route of HIV transmission is:-
exp: Routes of transmission of HIV: Sexual - MC Route - 90% new case in India; least dangerous or least efficient route (0. 01-0. 1) Blood - Least common Route (<5); Most dangerous / efficient route (90% chances) Needles / syringes - 0. 1 - 0. 03% chance Veical - 30% (from mother for child

question: HIV targeted intervention not done in
exp: Targeted intervention - It is a specific package of intervention & services which are given to population those who have either high risk of HIV or those who have repoed high risk of HIV. Groups with high risk of HIV are: Commercial sex workers Injecting Drug Users Truck Drivers Migrant Labour Street children Transgender Adolescents - Hence, option-4 is the answer.

question: Leprosy bacillus is cultured by using:-
exp: Leprosy: Oldest disease known. Caused by Mycobacterium leprae. Mode of transmission: Air droplets, skin contact, transplacental, breast feeding, insect bite, tattoo, corneal/organ transplantation. Mycobacterium leprae has no aificial culture media. Leprae bacilli are cultured by: Foot pad of mice. 9-banded armadillo. Other options: Bordet gengou medium: Bordetella Peussis. LJ medium: Mycobacterium Tuberculosis. Loeffler's serum slope: Corynebacterium Diphtheria.

question: Antiretroviral drugs are staed for HIV/ AIDS patients if CD4 count is:-
exp: A should be staed in all HIV positive patients regardless of WHO clinical stage and at any CD4 cell count. Normal CD4 count 900-1400 Oppounistic infection occurs if CD4 count less than 500.

question: Most common oppounistic infection in AIDS worldwide is:-
exp: AIDS:- - Caused by HIV. - Mode of transmission - Sexual, blood, needle/syringes, veical. - Prevalence - 0. 22%. - MC age group affected - 30-44yrs. - MC oppounistic infection in AIDS:- World: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia. India: Tuberculosis.

question: Multidrug (MDT) regimen under the National Leprosy Eradication Program for treatment of all Multibacillary Leprosy would include:-
exp: Paucibacillary Multibacillary Lesions <=5 >5 RX 6 months 12 months Follow-up 2 years 5 years Drugs Dapsone, Rifampicin Dapsone, Rifampicin, Clofazimine Now, India may soon adopt "Uniform MDT" regimen in which drugs used will be D + R + CF to all leprosy Patients.
